issue.title: <template> element closes <head>

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
A \<template> element inside a \<head> closes the head. 

See the following example: https://try.jsoup.org/~EGp3UZxQe503TJDHQEQEzm8IeUc

The \<template> element is allowed within other elements that accept meta data content (see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/template).

The \<head> element accepts meta data content (in fact it only accepts meta data content): https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/head

Therefore \<template> elements are valid inside a \<head>, and the \<head> should not be closed.

This also is like both Firefox and Chrome handle the example code.

issue.title: template element xml serialization removes the inner start/end tags

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body: After parsing the HTML fragment: using the following: doc.outputSettings().prettyPrint(false) doc.outputSettings().syntax(Document.OutputSettings.Syntax.xml) return doc.outerHtml() the output is as follows: That is, it is the same as the template content excluding the start and end tags. The whitespace is still preserved. The tree construction in Firefox and Chrome is the same as the source, with a `#document-fragment` node between the template element and the tr content. That is:

issue.title: Added full parser support for <template> tags

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
This implements the HTML5 parser spec for `<template>` tags.

Note that as jsoup is a parser and does not run scripts, and for unsurprising selector support, it does not wrap the contents of the template children in a Document fragment object. Per #1634

We could choose to add a TemplateElement class with extra functionality around cloning the children etc. Very open to suggestions here!

Fixes #1634
Fixes #1630
Fixes #1409
Fixes #1315

issue.title: Fix incorrect template element xml serialization

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
Fix #1315 

After parsing the HTML fragment, the inner start/end tags is included.

body: (Re-opening - while the core parser changes are implemented, I'm still happy to hear feedback here on how the API might be improved to help related use cases.)
(Closing to close out the milestone, but as ever, happy for feedback on ways to improve this)

issue.title: Closed parser/tree builder API

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body: Given the opinionated approach of HtmlParser re strict Html5 structure, which breaks templating schemes (e.g. Polymer/web components - see #600 and #941 and #901, and so on) I need a different tree builder. Unfortunately the tree builder API is closed for extension outside the package. Is there a reason this API is locked down?
